sentence.Network_en: We were still at the legation at Eaton Place.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们当时还在伊顿广场的公使馆。

sentence.Network_en: Our legation was upgraded to an embassy.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们的公使馆升级为大使馆.

sentence.Network_en: Inside the British legation a few armed soldiers walked about the gardens.
sentence.Network_cn: 在英国公使馆里,几个武装士兵在花园里踱来踱去.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting the sending of a papal legate; also the mission itself): from Latin legatio(n-), from legare 'depute, delegate, bequeath'

entry.def: A legation is a group of government officials and diplomats who work in a foreign country and represent their government in that country.
A legation is the building in which a legation works.

example.ex: We were still at the legation at Eaton Place.
example.tran: 我们当时还在伊顿广场的公使馆。

means.word_mean: 1. the post or office of legate
2. a permanent diplomatic mission headed by a minister

sentences.en: Our legation was upgraded to an embassy.
sentences.cn: 我们的公使馆升级为大使馆。
